Job Title: Business & Sales Operations Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Firm Background  Based in Palo Alto and New York, our fund is an SEC-registered private investment fund. Founded in 2017, the firm manages capital for individuals, trusts, endowments, foundations, and other institutions. We are a long-only, concentrated, value investment fund that focuses on the intersection of fundamental and climate analysis.   Position Overview The Business and Sales Operations Manager plays a pivotal role in supporting business development initiatives and the day-to-day operations of a rapidly scaling investment manager. This multifaceted position will provide comprehensive sales, operations, investor relations and administrative support and be a core part of our team.   Responsibilities  · Sales· Identify leads (based on target customer profile), research and qualify those leads · Conduct outreach to those leads via multiple channels, primarily LinkedIn and email · Design and improve upon email templates in our CRM system (Hubspot) that can be customized to run lead generation at scale · Draft personalized emails that demonstrate thoughtfulness, intention, and professionalism based on research of mutual connections, focus of work, research published, organization’s priorities, etc. · Run sales outreach campaigns on the CRM system – gathering data, analyzing results, and improving campaigns· Respond to any positive lead responses and set up meetings· Prepare bios and background research for the meetings· Update marketing materials (presentation, website, databases) on a monthly or quarterly basis· Investor Relations· Manage response to investor inquiries, leveraging all available resources in the firm· Collaborate with team to prepare drafts of due diligence questionnaires or reports · Confirm investor data completed by service providers prior to submitting to investors· Operations· Assist with various data entry and performance reporting tasks and maintain accurate records of important information on Excel spreadsheets· Process payments to vendors and service providers· Provide support on various operations and compliance projects and assignments· Administration· Manage and coordinate schedules, including arranging internal and external meetings· Take meeting minutes and distribute to attendees as needed· Provide support of ad-hoc administrative initiatives (e.g. Planning offsites, travel schedules, etc.)  Qualifications · Excellent written English – work done 100% in English · Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 2 years of working experience either in a sales role, communications, or investment company operations/sales support · Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software applications· Analytical, likes to look at data and use the data to improve sales strategies · An entrepreneurial spirit – resourceful in finding facts, data, and contact information on the web and publicly available sources · Honest, positive, and mature personality that is additive to an entrepreneurial, collaborative, team-oriented organization · Self-starter, able to self-manage tasks and projects yet know when to ask for help· Organized, good project manager capable of running and improving repeatable processes· Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion· Demonstrates good judgment in communicating to our clients with professionalism Benefits · Includes base salary, potential annual bonus based on team profitability, a 401(k) plan, medical and dental insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick days.· Remote work arrangement (US time zones) with quarterly team “off-sites”.· Collaborative environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Experience Level (if available): None
